radiographic_examinations.findings: Evidence of partial right temporal lobectomy with postoperative change; dilatation of the temporal horn of the right lateral ventricle; extensive periventricular and deep white matter confluent high signal intensity consistent with chronic microvascular ischemia; encephalomalacia within the right cerebellum; stable appearance of an extra-axial enhancing mass abutting the posteroinferior aspect of the right temporal bone measuring 2 x 1.5 cm; stable en plaque meningioma measuring 13 x 16 mm at the right frontal convexity; stable en plaque meningioma along the right side of the falx; no evidence of acute infarct; scattered foci of intraparenchymal susceptibility; extensive opacification of the right mastoid air cells.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Stable appearance of the extra-axial enhancing mass and both en plaque meningiomas.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple non-specific findings including partially dilated GB with mild fundal wall edema, mild rectal wall thickening, and mild bladder wall thickening.
